questions.question: What does Romeo ask of the Nurse?

choices.answer: He asks her to tell Juliet to wait for him on her balcony.
He asks her to ask Juliet to elope with him to Rome.
He asks her to tell Juliet to meet him by the fountain.
He asks her to tell Juliet to go to shrift and to marry him.

questions.question: What does Friar Lawrence assume when he discovers that Romeo has been up all night?

choices.answer: That Romeo has spent the evening fighting with the Capulets
That Romeo was out drinking with Mercutio and Benvolio.
That Romeo's love for Juliet has left him sleepless
That Romeo has spent the night with Rosaline

questions.question: Why does Juliet bid Romeo to "swear not by the moon."? .

choices.answer: The night is cloudy, and the moon is invisible
Juliet fears that swearing by it might make his love change.
The moon is too bright, so he might be blinded by it
There is no moon for him to swear by.

questions.question: What is the purpose of Mercutio's bawdy (sexual) humor in 2.1?

choices.answer: His dirty jokes contrast with religious images Romeo uses
Mercutio's language shows that he is a lower-class person.
His jokes are designed to offend Benvolio who is innocent.
His jokes show that he does not believe in God.

questions.question: What is Friar Lawrence's fear at the end of Act 2?

choices.answer: That Tybalt will interfere with R&J's wedding ceremony.
The swiftness and violence of R&J 's love will end violently
That R will forget his love for J as quickly as Rosaline.
That Montague and Capulet will seek revenge.

questions.question: Why does Friar Lawrence agree to marry Romeo and Juliet?

choices.answer: If Friar does not help Romeo, Romeo will commit suicide.
He believes Juliet is pregnant with Romeo's child.
He believes with Juliet's help, Romeo will forget Rosaline.
He hopes that their love will resolve the family conflict.

questions.question: After she returns from her visit to Romeo, how does the Nurse increase Juliet's suspense?

choices.answer: She tells a long story about her dead daughter, Susan.
She tells Juliet that she will tell her until after dinner.
She recounts all of the insults she endured from Mercutio.
She complains about her aching bones and her lack of breath.

questions.question: When Mercutio cannot find Romeo at the beginning of the act, what does Mercutio assume?

choices.answer: He assumes that Romeo still is in love with Rosaline.
He assumes Romeo has killed himself.
He assumes that Romeo has gone off to fight Tybalt.
He assumes that Romeo is in love with Juliet.

questions.question: Whom does Mercutio call the "Prince of Cats"?

choices.answer: Tybalt
Paris
Benvolio
Romeo

questions.question: What describes Juliet's feelings as she waits to hear the message from Romeo?

choices.answer: indifferent
angry
confident
impatient

questions.question: Who says?   "Lord how my head aches! ...My back a t'other side -- ah, my bad, my back!"

choices.answer: Lady Capulet
Rosaline
Juliet
The Nurse

questions.question: Who says, "It is too rash, to unadvised, too sudden;/Too like the lightning?

choices.answer: Romeo
Friar Lawrence
Juliet
Mercutio

questions.question: Who says the following line? "She speaks, yet she says nothing.  Her eye discourses."

choices.answer: Juliet
Paris
Nurse
Romeo

questions.question: Who speaks this line, "Good Peter, to hide her face; for her fan's the fairer face."

choices.answer: Benvolio
Mercutio
Peter
Romeo

questions.question: Who says,"Therefore love moderately; long love doth so; Too swift arrives as tardy as to slow."

choices.answer: The Prince
Tybalt
Friar Lawrence
Lord Capulet

questions.question: What does Juliet mean when she says, "Wherefore art thou Romeo?"

choices.answer: Why is Romeo a Montague?
Where is Romeo right now?
When will I see Romeo again?
Why is Romeo not here with me right now?

questions.question: When Juliet says, "I have no joy of this contract tonight," what does the word "contract" mean?

choices.answer: the exchange of lovers' vows
legal document
the threat of their future suicide
a kiss

questions.question: What does the character who says "She speaks, yet she says nothing.  Her eye discourses." mean?

choices.answer: Juliet is silent, yet her thoughts can be read in her face.
Juliet is speaking, but she is saying rambling incoherently.
Juliet is using sign language to communicate with him
Juliet is speaking, but her voice is too quiet.

questions.question: Who speaks these lines? "For this alliance may ... turn your households' rancor to pure love."

choices.answer: Lord Capulet
Friar Tuck
Friar Lawrence
The Prince

questions.question: What does Romeo mean "Alack, there lies more peril in thine eye than twenty of their swords."?

choices.answer: Cruel glance from Juliet would be more painful than a fight.
He is not afraid of fighting Tybalt; he is ready for action.
Juliet may become too dependent on his love.
Juliet will kick him in the face if he doesn't love her.
